step.em: Bring a detailed list of acceptable and prohibited foods with you to the restaurant.

details.text: Create a laminated list of foods that contain gluten for easy reference.

ul.li: Keeping this list on you at all times will ensure that you are ready to provide anyone with information about Celiac disease or gluten sensitivity

step.em: Go online and check the menu.

details.text: Some restaurants actually have gluten free options. But, this, of course, depends on the type of restaurant and food.

step.em: Ask for a hamburger with no bun!

details.text: You can do this at almost any place, just like asking for no mayo!

step.em: Ask about gluten-free options and ingredients.

tip.text: Call a restaurant twice before you visit with your gluten sensitive child. Make the first call several days ahead to see if the restaurant is a viable choice for your family, and call once again on the day you will be dining at the restaurant.
Notify the restaurant in advance about which day you will be eating out so that the management can be sure that gluten-free menu ingredients are available.
